Contents: @joegrifffiths Let's try out the following. Go to Settings > network > set up internet connection>use wifi > custom > Ip: Automatic > DHCP: Do not use > DNS: Manual > Primary DNS change it to: 8.8.8.8, secondary DNS change it to: 8.8.4.4 > MTU: Automatic > Proxy: Do not use > Test.

Name: Ask PlayStation

Contents: @jozh Hello. Login using the Family Manager account. Go to Settings > Parental Controls/Family Management. Select Family Management. Select the Child Family Member you wish to set a spending limit for. Go to Parental Controls > Monthly Spending Limit, choose the maximum dollar amount.

Name: Ask PlayStation
Post Title: @jozh Hello. Login using the Family Manager account. Go to Settings > Parental Controls/Family Management. Select Family Management. Select the Child Family Member you wish to set a spending limit for. Go to Parental Controls > Monthly Spending Limit, choose the maximum dollar amount.

Contents: @jjfiset Let's try out the following. Go to Settings > network > set up internet connection>use wifi > custom > Ip: Automatic > DHCP: Do not use > DNS: Manual > Primary DNS change it to: 8.8.8.8, secondary DNS change it to: 8.8.4.4 > MTU: Automatic > Proxy: Do not use > Test.

Contents: @siidar__ Hello, Go into Settings (up on the d-pad and far right) and choose System Storage Management. Select Captures. Select a game folder, press the Options button on your controller and select Delete. Select the items you no longer want and then hit the Delete button. ^NJ
Author: @AskPS_UK
Name: Ask PlayStation UK
Post Title:
@siidar__ Hello, Go into Settings (up on the d-pad and far right) and choose System Storage Management.
Select Captures.
Select a game folder, press the Options button on your controller and select Delete.
Select the items you no longer want and then hit the Delete button. ^NJ
